definition: worthy predecessor/distinguished person of the past/former sage
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation

sentences.english: The Founders were protective of the fledgling democracy.
sentences.chinese: 美國的建國先賢一心要保護這個新興的民主制度。

sentences.english: It is an interpretation of executive power that would make the Founders whirl in their graves.
sentences.chinese: 這一關於行政權力的解釋會讓開國先賢們死不瞑目。

sentences.english: To believe in the teachings of the ancient saints and sages.
sentences.chinese: 中國古聖先賢所教導的。

sentences.english: The ancient sages of China passed down a lot of wisdom in the form of proverbs.
sentences.chinese: 中國的古聖先賢用成語流傳很多智慧給下一代的人。

sentences.english: America’s founders acutely were aware of the importance of religious freedom.
sentences.chinese: 美國的建國先賢深知宗教自由的重要性。

sentences.english: Even Yao and Shun could not have done as much.
sentences.chinese: 即使堯舜這樣的先賢也做不到。

sentences.english: Sage Ran Zizhong bow temple is located in Heze City, 7 kilometers east.
sentences.chinese: 先賢冉子仲弓祠位於菏澤市東7公里處。

sentences.english: Our success will do credit to our forebears and bring benefit to our posterity.
sentences.chinese: 我們的成功將繼承先賢，澤被後世。

sentences.english: Tomb hollow cylindrical, such as the hanging bell-shaped , the sages of the tomb is located inside.
sentences.chinese: 墓室中空外圓，形如懸鐘，先賢的墳墓就設在裏面。

definition: a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
saint/sage/refers to Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]/the current reigning Emperor
